title: Can my school access my pictures on their WiFi if I am connected to it? - Quora

response.answer_text: If your school is anything like the one where I work as an IT specialist, there likely are guidelines or policies for acceptable use of their technology resources including the WiFi network. These policies may include restrictions on the type of content you can access on the web, such as pornography, violence, social media, shopping, etc., while connected to their network on your personal device or using a school-owned computer, as well as monitoring of network traffic that may violate such policies. In other words, you have no expectation of privacy on the network traffic generated by your use of their resources. That’s typically the limit, however. As for your phone and the pictures it contains, I believe the school doesn’t have the right to access the content of your phone, including pictures, unless you consent to it. TL;DR — The school can monitor and limit your network traffic but they don’t have the right to intrude on your personal device and access private information. However, I’m not a lawyer, so take this with a grain of salt.
